## Honey production changing trend by year

```{r libraries, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
library(plotly)
library(DT)
```

```{r datasets, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
honey <- read.csv(here::here("data/honeyproduction.csv"))

price <- honey %>%
  group_by(state) %>%
  summarise(ave_price = round(mean(priceperlb), 4))%>%
  arrange(desc(ave_price)) %>%
  head() %>%
  #mutate(order = fct_reorder(state, ave_price)) %>%
  mutate("full name" = c("Virginia",
                         "Nevada",
                         "Illinois",
                         "Kentucky",
                         "North Carolina",
                         "Tennessee"))
```

```{r productionchart, echo = FALSE, fig.align='center'}
production <- ggplot(honey,
                     mapping = aes(
                       x = year,
                       y = log10(totalprod),
                       color = state
                       )) +
  geom_line() +
  theme_bw(base_size = 14) +
  scale_x_continuous(
    breaks = c(
          1998, 1999, 2000, 2001, 2002, 2003, 2004, 2005,
          2006, 2007, 2008, 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012
          )) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 0.5, vjust = 0.5)) +
  labs(x = "Year", y = "log(Production)")

plotly::ggplotly(production)
```
